timeline.message:
Improvements of PSS/E importer:
- supporting both raw and RAW file extensions
- supporting STATUS = 0 of equipments
- modification of header detection
- reading Qmin and Qmax of generating units
- modification of targetQ setter
- better check of the number of windings of transformers

Improvements of PSS/E importer:
- supporting both raw and RAW file extensions
- supporting STATUS = 0 of equipments
- modification of header detection
- reading Qmin and Qmax of generating units
- modification of targetQ setter
- better check of the number of windings of transformers

Signed-off-by: Jean-Baptiste Heyberger <jbheyberger@gmail.com>

Improvement of switched shunts
Improvement of 2 windings transformers, with phase shift
First implementation of 3 windings transformers
Several checks to import different IEEE cases

Signed-off-by: Jean-Baptiste Heyberger <jbheyberger@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyText:
There is already an equivalent feature in IIDM, would it be equivalent in your case?
        Line line = network.newLine()
                .setId(id)
                .setEnsureIdUnicity(true)
               ...
timeline.author: geofjamg
geofjamg
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -468,7 +468,7 @@ public Network importData(ReadOnlyDataSource dataSource, NetworkFactory networkF
 
             // build container to fit IIDM requirements
             ContainersMapping containerMapping = ContainersMapping.create(ieeeCdfModel.getBuses(), ieeeCdfModel.getBranches(),
-                IeeeCdfBus::getNumber, IeeeCdfBranch::getTapBusNumber, IeeeCdfBranch::getzBusNumber, IeeeCdfBranch::getResistance,
+                IeeeCdfBus::getNumber, IeeeCdfBranch::getTapBusNumber, IeeeCdfBranch::getzBusNumber, IeeeCdfBranch -> 0,  IeeeCdfBranch::getResistance,

timeline.author: geofjamg
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -340,7 +340,7 @@ public Network importData(ReadOnlyDataSource dataSource, NetworkFactory networkF
                 LOGGER.debug("MATPOWER model {}", model.getCaseName());
 
                 ContainersMapping containerMapping = ContainersMapping.create(model.getBuses(), model.getBranches(),
-                    MBus::getNumber, MBranch::getFrom, MBranch::getTo, MBranch::getR, MBranch::getX, MatpowerImporter::isTransformer,
+                    MBus::getNumber, MBranch::getFrom, MBranch::getTo, MBranch -> 0, MBranch::getR, MBranch::getX,  MatpowerImporter::isTransformer,

timeline.author: geofjamg

timeline.bodyText:
Is there any reason to explicitly create a variable for adders?
You could write:
                ShuntCompensator shunt = voltageLevel.newShuntCompensator()
                        .setId(busId + "-SwSH-B" + i)
                        .setConnectableBus(busId)
                        .setSectionCount(1);
                        .newLinearModel() //TODO: use Binit and sbl.getNi(i) to initiate Bi, for now we use Binit to obtain de same load-flow results
                            .setBPerSection(psseSwShunt.getBinit())//TODO: take into account BINIT to define the number of switched steps in the case BINIT is different from the max switched steps
                            .setMaximumSectionCount(1)
                        .add()
                .add();
timeline.author: geofjamg

timeline.bodyText: Here also you could use IIDM unicity feature?
timeline.author: geofjamg

timeline.bodyText: Same remark than with shunts, it could be written without adder vars in a fluent way.
timeline.author: geofjamg
